multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have purple spots on both of my legs, a sore throat, abdominal pain, trouble walking, and my ankles are red and swollen.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms for about a week.
Do you have a history of any chronic illnesses or have you recently been diagnosed with any new health conditions?
No, I don't have a history of any chronic illnesses or recent new health conditions.
Have you been on any new medications or supplements recently?
No, I haven't taken any new medications or supplements recently.
Has anyone in your family had similar symptoms or been diagnosed with a disease that has similar symptoms?
No, my parents deny any history of similar symptoms or diseases in the family.
Do you recall experiencing any recent insect bites, scratches, or exposure to animals before these symptoms started?
No, I don't recall experiencing any insect bites, scratches, or exposure to animals before these symptoms started.
Have you had any recent travel history, particularly to rural or wooded areas?
No, I haven't had any recent travel to rural or wooded areas.
**Final Diagnosis:** Henoch-Schönlein purpura (HSP)
